bibl.title: Despatch from R. Dorsey Mohun to Assistant Secretary of State
Despatches from United States Consuls in Boma, 1888-1895
bibl.publisher: National Archives and Records Service General Services Administration

keywords.term: Leopold II, King of the Belgians, 1835-1909

div1.p:
Commercial Agency
Kongo Free State
Brussels, Belgium
Sept. 30, 1894.

To the Assistant Secretary State
Washington, D.C.

I have the honour to inform the State Department that His Majesty Leopold II, King of Belgium and Sovereign of the Kongo Free State has given me the Decoration of the "Royal Order of the Lion of the Congo" with the rank of Chevalier for "military services voluntarily rendered the Congo Free State during the Arab war of 1893 & 1894. I accepted this honour conditional upon the Governments permission.
I am sailing on October 20th by the "New York", and will bring the order back with me for deposit in the State Department finding action of Congress.

I am
I am, Sir,
Very respectfully
Your obedient servant
R. Dorsey Mohun
Commercial Agent
